about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: A red arrow pointing to the right on a traffic light means you may:

about.name: A red arrow pointing to the right on a traffic light means you may:

hasPart.assesses: A red arrow pointing to the right on a traffic light means you may: | A red arrow pointing to the right on a traffic light means you may: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: A red arrow means "stop." You must remain stopped until a green light or green arrow appears. Do not turn against a red arrow.

suggestedAnswer.text: Turn in that direction after slowing and checking for traffic.

comment.text: Turn in that direction after slowing and checking for traffic.

suggestedAnswer.text: Not turn in that direction until the light turns green.

comment.text: Not turn in that direction until the light turns green.

suggestedAnswer.text: Turn in that direction after you come to a complete stop.

comment.text: Turn in that direction after you come to a complete stop.

acceptedAnswer.text: Not turn in that direction until the light turns green.

comment.text: Not turn in that direction until the light turns green.

answerExplanation.text: A red arrow means "stop." You must remain stopped until a green light or green arrow appears. Do not turn against a red arrow.

comment.text: A red arrow pointing to the right on a traffic light means you may: | A red arrow means "stop." You must remain stopped until a green light or green arrow appears. Do not turn against a red arrow.

hasPart.name: When you see this yellow sign, you should:

about.name: When you see this yellow sign, you should:

hasPart.assesses: When you see this yellow sign, you should: | When you see this yellow sign, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: A five-sided sign indicates that you are near a school. Be aware and stop if children are in the crosswalk.

comment.text: Always stop at the crosswalk.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stop at the crosswalk until a crossing guards signals for you to go.

comment.text: Stop at the crosswalk until a crossing guards signals for you to go.

suggestedAnswer.text: Be prepared to stop if children are in the crosswalk.

comment.text: Be prepared to stop if children are in the crosswalk.

acceptedAnswer.text: Be prepared to stop if children are in the crosswalk.

comment.text: Be prepared to stop if children are in the crosswalk.

hasPart.name: This sign tells you that:
hasPart.assesses: This sign tells you that: | This sign tells you that: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns drivers about an upcoming winding road.

suggestedAnswer.text: No turns are allowed on the road.

comment.text: No turns are allowed on the road.
The road narrows ahead.

suggestedAnswer.text: There is a series of curves ahead.

comment.text: There is a series of curves ahead.

acceptedAnswer.text: There is a series of curves ahead.

comment.text: There is a series of curves ahead.

answerExplanation.text: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns drivers about an upcoming winding road.

hasPart.name: Which of the following statements is true?

about.name: Which of the following statements is true?

hasPart.assesses: Which of the following statements is true? | Which of the following statements is true? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Driving too slowly can be dangerous because it may cause drivers behind you to become frustrated and make dangerous moves to pass you. It is safest to drive with the flow of traffic, within the legal speed limit.

suggestedAnswer.text: Driving too slowly is not an unsafe practice.

comment.text: Driving too slowly is not an unsafe practice.

suggestedAnswer.text: Driving too slowly on certain highways can be dangerous.

comment.text: Driving too slowly on certain highways can be dangerous.

suggestedAnswer.text: The speed at which you drive a vehicle does not affect safety.

comment.text: The speed at which you drive a vehicle does not affect safety.

acceptedAnswer.text: Driving too slowly on certain highways can be dangerous.

comment.text: Driving too slowly on certain highways can be dangerous.

answerExplanation.text: Driving too slowly can be dangerous because it may cause drivers behind you to become frustrated and make dangerous moves to pass you. It is safest to drive with the flow of traffic, within the legal speed limit.

hasPart.name: You are on the freeway and traffic is merging into your lane. You should:

about.name: You are on the freeway and traffic is merging into your lane. You should:

hasPart.assesses: You are on the freeway and traffic is merging into your lane. You should: | You are on the freeway and traffic is merging into your lane. You should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When traffic permits, you should make room to allow vehicles to merge into your lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: Make room for the merging traffic, if possible.

comment.text: Make room for the merging traffic, if possible.

suggestedAnswer.text: Assert your right-of-way by driving faster.

comment.text: Assert your right-of-way by driving faster.
Always maintain your position.

acceptedAnswer.text: Make room for the merging traffic, if possible.

comment.text: Make room for the merging traffic, if possible.

answerExplanation.text: When traffic permits, you should make room to allow vehicles to merge into your lane.

hasPart.name: At an intersection with a yield sign, you:

about.name: At an intersection with a yield sign, you:

hasPart.assesses: At an intersection with a yield sign, you: | At an intersection with a yield sign, you: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When approaching a yield sign, drivers must give the right-of-way to traffic already in the lanes that they intend to enter or cross. Drivers should be prepared to stop when approaching a yield sign but may continue without stopping if there is no conflicting traffic.

suggestedAnswer.text: Must yield the right-of-way to cross traffic that is close enough to cause conflict.

comment.text: Must yield the right-of-way to cross traffic that is close enough to cause conflict.

suggestedAnswer.text: Must yield to vehicles only on your right.

comment.text: Must yield to vehicles only on your right.

suggestedAnswer.text: Should slow down but never stop.

comment.text: Should slow down but never stop.

acceptedAnswer.text: Must yield the right-of-way to cross traffic that is close enough to cause conflict.

comment.text: Must yield the right-of-way to cross traffic that is close enough to cause conflict.

answerExplanation.text: When approaching a yield sign, drivers must give the right-of-way to traffic already in the lanes that they intend to enter or cross. Drivers should be prepared to stop when approaching a yield sign but may continue without stopping if there is no conflicting traffic.

comment.text: At an intersection with a yield sign, you: | When approaching a yield sign, drivers must give the right-of-way to traffic already in the lanes that they intend to enter or cross. Drivers should be prepared to stop when approaching a yield sign but may continue without stopping if there is no conflicting traffic.
